snippet: A new generation of wearable devices for sleeping infants can gather lots of data, but parents might struggle to figure out what to do with it all.
abstract: Molly Wood Machine Learning column criticizes wave of new wearable devices that allow parents to track their babies' sleeping habits; observes that gadgets simply do not work well.
lead_paragraph: A new generation of wearable devices for sleeping infants can gather lots of data, but parents might struggle to figure out what to do with it all.

headline.main: Baby Monitors for a Smart Nursery, but Parents Are Still Better
headline.print_headline: Smart Nurseries Track a Baby’s Sleep, but Don’t Yet Aid It
